settings.startCollapsedHelp: Should the sidebar start closed when opening the window for the first time?
settings.displaySessionNotesHelp: When enabled, a session notes window will automatically open when a play session starts
settings.defaultAddToSessionHelp: When in play mode, should the checkbox when creating an entry default to on or off?
settings.sessionBookmarkHelp: When enabled, a bookmark for the current Session will be shown at the front of the bookmark bar
settings.sessionDisplayModeHelp: Choose how sessions are displayed in the campaign directory

keybindings.historyBackHelp: Move "back" in the history of the current tab
keybindings.historyForwardHelp: Move "forward" in the history of the current tab

settings.autoRefreshRollTablesHelp: When enabled, generator roll tables will be automatically refreshed with new values when the module loads
settings.genericFoundryTabHelp: When enabled, Entries will have a Foundry tab that can hold any type of Foundry document (scenes, actors, items, etc.). This is useful for driving play sessions entirely from Entries without using Campaigns/Sessions.
settings.rollTableSettingsHelp: Configure settings for the random generators

rollTableConfig.defaultTypeNPCHelp: Default type to use when creating an NPC character entry
rollTableConfig.defaultTypeTownHelp: Default type to use when creating a town location entry
rollTableConfig.defaultTypeStoreHelp: Default type to use when creating a store location entry
rollTableConfig.defaultTypeTavernHelp: Default type to use when creating a tavern location entry

settings.speciesListHelp: Define the species to make available.  These cross all Settings - file an issue if you have need different lists per Setting.
settings.hideBackendWarningHelp: If you're not using the backend, this lets you turn off the notification that it's missing
settings.enableToDoListHelp: If disabled, the todo list feature will be turned off.
settings.autoRelationshipsHelp: If enabled, the system will automatically suggest changes to relationships between entries based on changes made to the description.
settings.imagesHelp: Configure image visibility settings for different content types
settings.showTypesInTreeHelp: When true, if the Setting directory is not grouped by type, it will show the type of each Entry in the tree.
settings.subTabsSavePositionHelp: When enabled, every tab will remember which interior sub-tab was open and return to it when you re-open that tab. When disabled, tabs will always revert to the first one (usually description).
settings.storyWebAutoArrangeHelp: When enabled, story webs will rearrange to try to keep a clean picture.  When disabled, you can position everything exactly how you want.
settings.customFieldsHelp: Configure additional fields and AI instructions for each content type
settings.storyWebSettingsHelp: Configure line colors/styles and element text for story webs

dwarf.name: Dwarf
dwarf.description: Stout and resilient, dwarves are known for their craftsmanship, endurance, and strong connection to mountains and stonework. They are typically short and stocky, with thick beards and sturdy builds that emphasize their toughness.

elf.name: Elf
elf.description: Graceful and long-lived, elves possess keen senses, a natural affinity for magic, and an enduring connection to nature. They are tall and slender, with pointed ears, angular features, and an otherworldly beauty.

halfling.name: Halfling
halfling.description: Small and nimble, halflings are cheerful and resourceful, known for their luck and ability to avoid danger. They are short, standing around three feet tall, with round faces, curly hair, and a friendly demeanor.

human.name: Human
human.description: Versatile and ambitious, humans adapt to any environment, excelling in a wide range of skills and professions. They vary widely in height, build, skin tone, and facial features, reflecting the diversity of their cultures.

dragonborn.name: Dragonborn
dragonborn.description: Proud and powerful, dragonborn are humanoid dragons with a strong sense of honor and an innate breath weapon. They are tall and muscular, covered in colorful scales, with reptilian heads, clawed hands, and tails.

gnome.name: Gnome
gnome.description: Curious and inventive, gnomes are small and agile, known for their sharp minds and love of tinkering. They are short, with pointed ears, a mischievous demeanor, and a knack for finding hidden treasures.

half-elf.name: Half-Elf
half-elf.description: Blending human versatility with elven grace, half-elves are charismatic and adaptable, fitting into both worlds yet fully belonging to neither. They have slightly pointed ears, angular facial features, and a mix of human and elven traits that vary by ancestry.

half-orc.name: Half-Orc
half-orc.description: Strong and tenacious, half-orcs inherit the endurance and fighting spirit of their orcish ancestry while often striving to prove themselves beyond it. They are tall and powerfully built, with green or gray skin, prominent lower tusks, and thick brows.

tiefling.name: Tiefling
tiefling.description: Marked by infernal heritage, tieflings possess fiendish traits, an innate resilience to fire, and a talent for magic. They have horns, tails, and unusual eye and skin colors, ranging from deep reds to purples and blues.

labels.backendURLHint: Output from script to deploy the backend.
labels.APITokenHint: Output from script to deploy the backend.
labels.useGmailIdeasHint: When enabled, idea items will be created from the Gmail inbox

labels.emailDefaultCampaignHint: The campaign to use by default for email features (ex. emailing idea items)
labels.textModelHint: Select the AI model to use for text generation
labels.imageModelHint: Select the AI model to use for image generation

notifications.missingLabel: Each custom field must have a label
notifications.duplicateKey: Two custom fields have the same name. Please rename one so keys are unique.

labels.descriptionField: Field that holds the description to be used for image generation
labels.lightingPlaceholder: e.g., golden hour, moody rim light

images.promptHint: Create a template for AI image generation. Use {FIELD} to reference field values in your prompt. Available fields are shown in the drop-down.  All default fields are passed automatically, so you only need to reference them if you want to give a specific instruction related to one of them.

labels.fieldTokenHint: Use {FIELD} to reference another field when building the prompt.  Available fields are shown in the drop-down. All default fields are passed automatically, so you only need to reference them if you want to give a specific instruction related to one of them.
labels.descriptionFieldPlaceholder: Select field to use as description...

labels.refreshAllHelp: Replace any used items with new ones

notifications.refreshStarted: Generating new names for roll tables in the background
notifications.refreshError: Failed to refresh roll tables. Check console for details.

storyWebSettings.title: Configure Story Web Settings
storyWebSettings.fieldsHint: The fields in this list will be displayed in the tooltip when hovering over entities in a Story Web.

notifications.duplicateColorIds: Duplicate color IDs found. Please ensure all color IDs are unique.
notifications.duplicateStyleIds: Duplicate style IDs found. Please ensure all style IDs are unique.

labels.generateImageTooltip: Generate a new image in the background after creating

help.settingFeeling: ex. "Rugged and dangerous with low level of magic" - Improves AI generation

fields.strongStartHelpText: A strong start is a short, impactful event that sets the tone for the session. Click to read more from Lazy DM.
fields.name: Name

arc.participantHelpText: Characters and organizations likely to come up during the arc

session.addJournalDrag: (or drag/drop a journal or journal page)
session.loreHelpText: Tweet-sized bits of useful and interesting information. Click to read more from Lazy DM.
session.itemHelpText: Magic items that fit your PCs and the plot. Click to read more from Lazy DM.
session.npcHelpText: NPCs likely to be encountered in the session.
session.monsterHelpText: Monsters that fit the situation and location. Click to read more from Lazy DM.
session.vignetteHelpText: Scenes that bring resolution, open new paths, shift the story.  1 per 45 minutes. Click to read more from Lazy DM.
session.locationHelpText: Detailed, memorable, fantastic locations the characters can explore. Click to read more from Lazy DM.

front.portentHelpText: Grim portents are the events that will occur if the danger is not dealt with. They can bring resolution, open new paths, shift the story.

storyWeb.removeRelationshipConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this relationship? This will remove the relationship on the entries, not just the diagram.
storyWeb.createConnectionPrompt: You dropped an entry on top of an existing node. Do you want to create a connection between them?

campaign.loreHelpText: Track big campaign-level secrets and smaller ones that you aren't ready to deliver. Click to read more from Lazy DM.

backend.successfulConnection: Successfully connected to Campaign Builder backend.
backend.failedConnection: Failed to connect to backend - check your "advanced" settings to make sure they properly match the backend server you deployed.  You'll be unable to used advanced features in the meantime.
backend.versionMismatch: The version of your World & Campaign Builder backend ($1) doesn't match the version required by the module version you have installed ($2).  Please update one or the other (or both).  You'll be unable to use advanced features in the meantime.
backend.emailSettingsNotSet: You have enabled the email idea list feature, but you haven't set a default Setting or Campaign.  Please set these in the advanced settings.
backend.rollTablesNotAvailable: Backend is not available. Automatic RollTables will not be refreshed. Configure the backend in Advanced Settings to enable AI-generated names that match your world's theme.

notifications.todoReferenceNotFound: The linked reference for this to-do item no longer exists.

migration.minimumVersionRequired: Campign Builder cannot migrate from version {0}. You must first upgrade to version {1} or higher before upgrading to {2}.
migration.cannotOpen: Campaign Builder cannot be opened because migration failed. Please check the console for details and resolve the migration issue.

notifications.documentIndexesRepaired: All document indexes have been successfully repaired!
